alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with locally higher amounts possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Greenville, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Ripogenus, Mount Katahdin, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, New Canada, Telos Lake, Churchill Dam, Chamberlain Lake, Tamway, South Branch Pond, Baxter State Park, Chesuncook, northwestern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Fish River Lake and Lobster Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
